title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.4 - Employee safety

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.4 - Employee safety

State Regulations
(a) To promote
employee safety, the authority shall provide and maintain work places, machinery and equipment in a safe and reliable condition. If repairs affecting
employee safety are necessary, no employee should be permitted to operate such
equipment until necessary repairs are made. Grinding machines must have guards. Gears, belts and drives on machines must be enclosed. Masks for incinerator
cleaning, goggles and similar safety equipment must be provided to
employees. (b) As a safety
precaution, an employee should be aware of the nature of the fluid contained in
the piping on which he is working. Therefore, piping should be color coded in
accordance with standards listed below. This coding can be accomplished by
painting or by banding the pipe at frequent intervals with colored tape. The
direction of the flow should be indicated by an arrow. Oil lines

Blue

Gas lines

Buff

Steam lines

Dark red

Cold water lines

Green

Hot water lines

Brown

Waste lines

Black

Fire lines

Bright red

Electric conduit

Black
(c) Swift and appropriate medical attention
must be provided when necessary. The authority should establish a plan of
operation for obtaining such medical service. All accidents must be
reported
(see §
1631-2.2, subd. [c] above) and the
authority should take such action as will insure against repetition of similar
accidents. First aid kits, properly stocked, should be kept in management
office or maintenance shop and in any other place considered
necessary. Notes
